page.title: 20RELIGION
page.content: Certain brasses in Haccombe church date back to 1586. The church also has some Flemish stained glass windows. Haccombe church has no tower but it does have the oldest church bell in Devon. In the crypt there are a number of coffins containing members of the Carew family. On 19th July l985 there will be a special service at Haccombe to remember the 400 anniversary of the sinking of the Mary Rose. Vice Admiral Sir George Carew was in charge of the ship when it sank in the Solent in 1545. The three churches are now united into one parish in charge of one priest. The Rev. Southwood is Rector of Combeinteignhead, vicar of Stokeinteignhead and Archpriest of Haccombe. He has a retired priest, Rev. Shaw to help him with services.
